availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Goodpaster. Married to Betsy Beel Goodpaster in Bath County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1837. Father of Mary Goodpaster, Martha Goodpaster, Levi Goodpaster, Colgette Goodpaster, and Jane Goodpaster. Married to America Ulery Goodpaster in Bath County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1862. Stepfather of John Ulery, Elizabeth Ulery, and Eliza Ulery. Farmer in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 369A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 11-12.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 59B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273004.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994028, Bath County Marriages, p. 129.
